heisig_chinese_memo: A tongue allows a mouth to speak a thousand things.
heisig_constituent: tongue, thousand, drop, ten, needle, mouth
heisig_story: The primitive for mouth and the character for thousand naturally form the idea of tongue if one thinks of a thousand mouths able to speak the same language, or as we say, "sharing a common tongue." It is easy to see the connection between the idiom and the kanji if you take its image literally: a single tongue being passed around from mouth to mouth.
koohiiStory1: What is in a mouth that permits it to speak a thousand things? Yes, a tongue.
koohiiStory2: Kissing a thousand mouths eventually gets you some tongue.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The tongue radical and the tongue kanji are exactly the same! Yee-haw!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Youâ€™re sound asleep in bed when your tongue drops out of your mouth and you start to drool, getting saliva all over the bed sheet (ã—ãŸ). You wake up with a soggy patch of sheet near your mouth and wipe the drool off your face. Your significant other sees the whole thing.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Your significant other had been watching you sleep with your tongue out for a while now, so you're super embarrassed you wet the sheets with your nasty tongue drool. You feel very judged and embarrassed.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: a thousand (åƒ) mouths have (å£) tongues
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A tongue allows a mouth to speak a thousand things.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The word " tongue " in the oracle bone inscriptions is all taken from the tongue of a snake. It may be because the tongue is split, which is very easy to recognize, and the tongue is the most sensitive, like the sharpness of speech. It is called "splendid tongue and lotus" with beautiful words; "sweet mouth and slippery tongue" with fancy words; "big tongue" with clumsy speech; "open mouth and tongue" when you are afraid or unable to speak.

The word " drink " in oracle bone inscriptions is like a person sticking out his tongue and sipping water from a wine bottle. See " drink ". Inscriptions are used as the original meaning of tongue, but also to tell, and also used as the name of sacrifice and person. Bronze inscriptions have the same configuration as oracle bone inscriptions and are mostly used as clan emblems. Sleeping Tiger Di Qin Bamboo Slips: "Multi-tongue" means more words. See " yan ".

" Tongue " in the Qin and Han Dynasty variants " ğ ¯‘ " and " ğ¤¯ ", "Said Wen. "Tongue": "Tongue is in the mouth, so it is spoken and not tasted. It is dry from the mouth, and dry is also sound. All the tongue belongs to the tongue." "Said Wen. Mouth": "ğ ¯‘, stop the mouth. From the mouth, æ°’ province sound. ğ¤¯, the ancient text is from Gan."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The tongue of an oracle bone inscription sticks out of its mouth, which looks like saliva or saliva. The original meaning is tongue. The tongue of a golden inscription is split on the tip of the tongue, which is actually taken from the tongue of a snake. Because the shape of snake tongue is very typical and easy to recognize, the ancients used snake tongue as the pictogram of " tongue ".

Elaboration: The word " tongue" in the oracle bone inscriptions is all taken from the tongue of a snake. It may be because the tongue is split, which is very easy to recognize, and the tongue is the most sensitive, like the sharpness of speech. It is called "splendid tongue and lotus" with beautiful words; "sweet mouth and slippery tongue" with fancy words; "big tongue" with clumsy speech; "open mouth and tongue" when you are afraid or unable to speak. The word " drink" in oracle bone inscriptions is like a person sticking out his tongue and sipping water from a wine bottle. See " drink". Inscriptions are used as the original meaning of tongue, but also to tell, and also used as the name of sacrifice and person. Bronze inscriptions have the same configuration as oracle bone inscriptions and are mostly used as clan emblems. Sleeping Tiger Di Qin Bamboo Slips: "Multi-tongue" means more words. See " yan". " Tongue" in the Qin and Han Dynasty variants " ğ ¯‘" and " ğ¤¯", "Said Wen. "Tongue": "Tongue is in the mouth, so it is spoken and not tasted. It is dry from the mouth, and dry is also sound. All the tongue belongs to the tongue." "Said Wen. Mouth": "ğ ¯‘, stop the mouth. From the mouth, æ°’ province sound. ğ¤¯, the ancient text is from Gan."

tongue
Basic explanation of words
tongue
shÃ©
The organ that distinguishes taste, helps chewing and pronunciation in the mouth of humans or animals: the tongue. Tongue ploughing (a. Refers to studying diligently; b. In the old days, scholars taught apprentices and made a living according to the word, like a farmer who plows the field to get millet). Swords and tongues.
The synonym for linguistic debate: tongue war (intensive discussion).
Something like a tongue: a visor. Tongue of fire.
The bell or the hammer in the release.
Refers to the part protruding up and down on both sides of the target.
tongue

tongue
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
tongue
